text: й ® The polar case 15 known а5 perfect complements. ‘ e This occurs when the production process is such that trade-offs are impossible and capital and labour A must be used in fixed proportions. — [ e Any deviation from a point which satisfies those proportions (A) is modelled as requiring an infinite amount of the other input to compensate. Alternatively you can think of it as saying that if one input is held fixed, then increases in the other have no productive benefits.
